newsitem.title: GERMANY: Kohl says Germany to hit 3.0 EMU deficit target.
newsitem.headline: Kohl says Germany to hit 3.0 EMU deficit target.

text.p: Chancellor Helmut Kohl said on Friday Germany would meet the European monetary union budget deficit target of 3.0 percent of gross domestic product.
"I've said we'll meet the criteria and we'll meet them with 3.0," Kohl told RTL television in an interview recorded at his holiday home in Austria.
Kohl said budget plans for 1998 and the developments in the 1997 budget made clear Germany would meet the criteria for the single currency, due to begin in 1999.

Asked if he would be prepared to accept a budget deficit figure of 3.1 percent of GDP, Kohl replied: "I've told you we'll make 3.0. Why do you want to talk the whole time about something I'm convinced won't happen?"
The chancellor said in the interview, excerpts of which were played to Reuters ahead of broadcast later on Friday, that he did not feel boxed in by the 3.0 target.
Bavarian state premier Edmund Stoiber has led a high-profile campaign for a strict interpretation of the membership criteria laid down in the Maastricht Treaty.
